I've heard of friends not being accepted to some very good religious private schools because of their religion. Are teachers afraid they might contanimate the population with different beliefs? Or is it a different problem?
 
 Thought? Opinions?

I've heard of friends not being accepted to some very good religious private schools because of their religion. Are teachers afraid they might contanimate the population with different beliefs? Or is it a different problem?

 I think that is the right of a private school especially if it's religious. Now if they claim that all people are welcome to apply and they won't discriminate based on religion that's different, but if it's a private school they are allowed to discriminate based on religion.
Thanks zachav for answering my posts in something other than big word mumbo jumbo. I appretiate it!
